DataElement.preferredName: InterProScan Input Programming Parameter Use Checksum Flag java.lang.Boolean
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A computer program developed by the European Bioinformatics Institute that scans an input protein sequence against a range of stored protein signatures.:Anything added into a sytem.:A value that is passed to a routine._The purpose for or application or employment of something for functional or beneficial purposes.:A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true._Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Boolean value (true or false).

The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A computer program developed by the European Bioinformatics Institute that scans an input protein sequence against a range of stored protein signatures.:Anything added into a sytem.:A value that is passed to a routine.

Concepts.definition: A computer program developed by the European Bioinformatics Institute that scans an input protein sequence against a range of stored protein signatures.
A value that is passed to a routine.

Property.preferredDefinition: The purpose for or application or employment of something for functional or beneficial purposes.:A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Boolean value (true or false).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
